text: [Music]
the twin sisters a long long time ago in
the village there lived a farmer with
his twin daughters Lina and Nancy he
loved them dearly and would play with
them teach them to study and all kinds
of things
people of the village too were fond of
the two polite kind girls but when they
grew a little older and became about ten
years old something changed hey Mari
come out to play we found a whole new
tree with fresh apples in the forest
today really though I can't come why not
my mother won't let me mari is not going
anywhere
Lina and Nancy you are growing up now
you must stop this nonsense of playing
with boys girls are supposed to look
pretty and learn cooking and cleaning
not play around in forests and get dirty
what it's not your fault I must speak to
your father
Nancy and Lina walked off sad and
confused they went to another friend's
house hello mrs. chick hello girls what
brings you here we wanted to ask Sally
if she wants to come to the forest with
us no I have started teaching her
stitching and knitting I could teach you
too if you like you really must learn
useful things rather than playing in the
forest you are growing up now and girls
must look pretty and learn to stitch and
knit Nancy and Leena heard that and
walked off sadly
what is going on how come suddenly all
our friends have been stopped from play
look there if boys can still play why
can't girls Lena
Nancy want to go tree climbing in the
forest
not right now Steven maybe later
Nancy and Lena could not wait to meet
their father and ask him why suddenly
all their girlfriends had been asked to
stop playing ah my two angels ours your
day dinner is ready already Thank You
girls
why am i angels not chirpy and targeted
as always what is wrong father
why must girls only look pretty and cook
and clean or stitch and knit who told
you this today when we went out to call
our friends to come to the forest Nancy
and Lena told their father everything
that had happened that day
Jonathan was aghast why can boys play
what girls can't girls can do anything
that boys can do my dear truly there is
no difference but then we must only
girls know how to cook well I know how
to cook don't I and I'm not a girl
everyone must know things like cooking
and cleaning and stitching and anything
useful that they can learn it is not
about girls or boys girls are allowed to
learn anything anything even horse
riding even horse riding do you want to
learn yes
so Jonathan started teaching the girls
horse riding soon the girls became very
good at it but the people of the village
did not like girls riding horses you
really must stop y'all girls from war
they do things that boys do it's not
correct for girls to ride horses and
climb trees they must learn to cook
clean stitch and look after their houses
girls can do anything they set their
hearts to they are no lesser than boys
my daughters are not hurting or harming
anyone and I shall not stop them
beardy can girls earn a living Jonathan
tell me why not I plan to teach my girls
just that when they become older I am
going to teach them not just how I grow
grain but they will help me trade it in
the market as well girls doing business
that is atrocious
if you insist Jonathan I am afraid we
shall have to boycott you and your
family from the village think again my
girls and I are doing nothing wrong
chief in fact I urge you all to give
your daughters the freedom to learn what
they want why should girls be dependent
on boys girls can learn to do business
and men can learn to cook and look after
the house Jonathan does not know what he
speak
girl's doing business and men learning
to cook very well if that is what you
want you and your daughters will no
longer be allowed to participate in the
events of the village as you wish chief
but someday you will see that I am right
soon there was to be a sports meet in
the village in which boys from twenty
other villages would participate the
entire village was rife with activity
but Jonathan and his daughters were not
allowed to take part in the preparations
Oh Minister Roland himself is coming for
the opening ceremony our officials must
be immaculate I want to see the sports
meet but we aren't allowed you are not
allowed on the field but you can be
there outside of it and watch from the
highest point in the village yes soon
the day of the sports meet arrived Lena
and Nancy climbed a tree that overlooked
the stands and could see the entire
village from there they saw Minister
Roland came with his son who was also
running a race as everyone was enjoying
the games
[Music]
Thunder a local goon kidnapped the
minister's son and now we have the
athletes from Sandhurst calm and March
before the minister
Nancy what is that flying is that
carriage going at such top speed look
two away from the stadium strange you
think we should tell the chief who will
listen to us Nancy plus by the time we
tell this the carriage would have
gone far
goodness knows where come let's follow
him
so the two girls got onto their horses
and followed the carriage the carriage
stopped deep into the forest at a cave
the girls hid behind the trees watching
isn't that Minister Rovin son yes he's
been kidnapped we must tell the
villagers Lena why don't you go and tell
father and the chief while I keep a
watch on the cave from here will you be
safe I'll climb this tree and remain
hidden in the branches now go and take
the horses with you be careful
Lena wrote back to the village and tried
to tell the chief everything but the
chief would not hear you and your sister
are not allowed here remember but I have
something very important to tell you
chief leave child when the chief would
not listen to her Lena suddenly ran to
minister Roland and told him everything
the minister and the villagers rushed to
the spot in the forest Lena took them -
and Nancy told them what she had seen
they have kept your son in that cave and
are loading things in carts I think they
are going to leave soon the villagers
and the guards attacked the cave took
the kidnappers prisoners and saved
Minister Roland son I'm so proud of you
girls
my son is safe only because of your
daughters Jonathan chief you do well to
have girls be so independent in your
village
not High Minister it is Jonathan and his
daughters who have taught us all a
valuable lesson Donnison you were right
girls can do anything that boys can and
they should be allowed to wear the girls
or boys none is stronger or weaker than
the other both can do anything boys can
cook and girls can ride horses or
anything else as long as it is useful
[Music]
